article_title: The Mets’ Misfortune? It’s Not All About Bad Luck
article_text:
You’ve heard this quote before, or at least pieces of it, because it is a tired cliché that applies to just about anything. But it was a baseball executive, Branch Rickey, who said it, and it is worth repeating when considering the apparent misfortune of the sad, snake-bitten, injury-plagued, oh-if-only-things-went-their-way New York Mets.

“Things worthwhile generally don’t just happen. Luck is a fact, but should not be a factor. Good luck is what is left over after intelligence and effort have combined at their best....

twitter.description: After rookie pitcher Steven Matz became the latest Mets player to go down with an injury Thursday, the Mets are seemingly better positioned than ever to cast themselves as the victims of bad luck. But the best organizations have the talent, depth and will to overcome that.
twitter.creator: @BrianCostaWSJ

image.alt: The Mets’ misfortune? It’s not all about bad luck
